image.altText: A collection of scrolled parchments.

props.synopsis: As counter-terrorism police investigate the torching of a Melbourne synagogue on Friday, its community is fighting to save priceless Torah scrolls damaged in the arson attack.

title.children: Inside the fight to save holy scrolls damaged in synagogue blaze

image.altText: An illustration of three women looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: For generations words like fat, obese and overweight have been thrown around like hand grenades. In medical settings, the damage dealt can last generations. And the victims are overwhelmingly female.

title.children: The hidden impact of fat shaming in Australia's medical system

image.altText: Analyn 'Logee' Osias smiles for a selfie with the sun softly shining on tents behind her.

props.synopsis: A court hears James Pualic, who has pleaded guilty to murdering his ex-partner in her Bendigo home, could not regulate his emotions and had a long-standing problem with alcohol and illegal substances.

title.children: Supreme Court hears killer had 'propensity to explode' with rage

image.altText: A hand holds the Essure contraceptive device

props.synopsis: Despite a Victorian judge rejecting claims that a female contraceptive device caused them major health problems, women engaged in a class action have vowed to keep fighting.

title.children: Women disappointed by Essure class action judgement vow to fight on

image.altText: A man in a cap looks with a suspicious look on his face.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has green lit environmental plans for two mineral sands mines in western Victoria, which will cover a combined 5,000 hectares of agricultural land.

title.children: Farmers devastated as mineral sands mines receive environmental approval

image.altText: Unidentified woman seated on a couch. She's wearing leggings and a grey cardigan.

props.synopsis: Victim-survivors escaping domestic violence are often sent to motels or hotels, but support service Safe Steps says 'critical incidents' are on the rise. That's why they're doing things differently with Sanctuary, a wrap-around crisis accommodation model that boasts a safe exit rate of 98 per cent.

title.children: 'It saves lives': Support system for women fleeing violence has 98pc safe-exit rate

image.altText: Firefights walk past fire damage and smashed glass at the Synagogue.

props.synopsis: After it was declared a "likely terrorist incident", Australia's key security agencies are being brought together to investigate the arson attack on the Adass Israel Synagogue in Melbourne.

title.children: What we know about the synagogue terror attack investigation

image.altText: A bull shark swims towards camera in an all ocean blue background other sharks silhouetted in distance

props.synopsis: The Victorian Fisheries Authority is advising people to stay out of the Mitchell River in state's east after a bull shark sighting.

title.children: Alert for swimmers as bull shark seen in popular Victorian river

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: The RBA has kept the cash rate unchanged at 4.35 per cent in December, for a ninth-straight meeting. The next chance borrowers have for a reprieve is in February.

title.children: Reserve Bank keeps rates on hold but leaves door open to February cut

image.altText: Albanese gestures with both hands, a crowd of Jewish men flanking him.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has assured the Adass Israel community in Melbourne that his government will provide "whatever support is necessary financially" to rebuild the burnt synagogue.

title.children: Albanese vows to help rebuild synagogue during much-anticipated visit

image.altText: An old magazine advertisement showing smiling women.

props.synopsis: KPMG announced it would be closing all of Mosaic Group's Katie stores after it was found the business was largely operating at a loss.

title.children: Katies store closures are a tipping point for old-school bricks-and-mortar fashion

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: An investigation found the telecommunications company made 473 breaches during a disruption in March, with Telstra's Triple Zero call centre failing to properly transfer calls to emergency services.

title.children: Telstra slapped with $3 million fine for triple-0 network outage

image.altText: Helicopter landed on a beach with people nearby.

props.synopsis: From the air it must have looked a great spot to land, a big stretch of white sand and miles from anywhere. Little did this "helicopter safari" group know, one of Tasmania's most vocal opponents to helicopters in wilderness areas was watching on.

title.children: Outrage revealed over 'helicopter safari' mass landing on remote beach

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair wearing a traditional red headwrap and belt. Iraq village in background

props.synopsis: Thirty-eight young people have been named 2025 ABC Heywire winners for their resilience, courage and desire to create change. Here's where you can find their stories.

title.children: Heywire winners reveal 'brave and authentic' stories of regional Australia

image.altText: A police officer carrying a woman from a building following an airstrike.

props.synopsis: The comments come after Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy told incoming US President Donald Trump he would be open to talks, but was sceptical Vladimir Putin would want peace.

title.children: Ukraine hit by strikes as ally hints peace talks possible within months

image.altText: Charli XCX with messy hair wearing a white shirt and looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: In a blockbuster year for music releases, nothing excited us more than these 50 albums.

title.children: Fifty incredible 2024 albums that weren't released by Taylor Swift

image.altText: A man withdraws cash from an ATM in Singapore

props.synopsis: Singaporean scam victims could lose access to their own money as the country ramps up efforts to curb hundreds of millions of dollars lost to scams.

title.children: Singapore's radical solution to global scam epidemic

image.altText: A booking photograph of Luigi Mangione at State Correctional Institution

props.synopsis: New York prosecutors have filed murder and other charges against Luigi Nicholas Mangione in the killing of UnitedHealthcare's CEO, according to an online court docket.

title.children: Luigi Mangione charged with murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO

image.altText: A man speaks stands up and speaks with a microphone inside an elaborate gold mosque

props.synopsis: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad raises critical questions about the future of Syria and who speaks for its people. Here's what we know about Hayat Tahrir al-Sham and its leader, Abu Mohammad al-Golani.

title.children: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Golani, the man facing a $10 million bounty?

image.altText: A group of people gathered outside a lit-up white weatherboard house at night.

props.synopsis: In the hours before Suzy Wood died she heard one last song from a choir gathered outside her home. In the days afterwards, it emerged that it wasn't the first time magic had struck at number 27.

title.children: When magic struck twice at number 27

image.altText: A photo of Holly Bowles from the funeral order of service.

props.synopsis: Friends and family — some wearing pink and others with blue and yellow ribbons in their hair — have gathered to celebrate the life of Holly Morton-Bowles, who died after consuming methanol-laced drinks in Laos.

title.children: 'In our hearts forever': Holly Morton-Bowles farewelled

image.altText: A large ship in port.

props.synopsis: A world-first bid to turn the Latrobe Valley's brown coal into hydrogen hits a massive hurdle, after a major international partner backs out of a trial in the region.

title.children: Bid to turn Latrobe Valley's coal into hydrogen hits major roadblock

image.altText: A doctor sitting behind a desk. Subtitles say 'Do you honestly think metformin is the answer by now?'

props.synopsis: Online scammers are exploiting the faces and names of real Australian doctors to sell dietary supplements and peddle harmful medical advice, putting patients' health at risk.

title.children: Melbourne doctor finds himself at centre of deepfake scam

image.altText: camwmb_LakeBolac_2511_00-15-00.07

props.synopsis: A social media post has helped a small school in western Victoria find a science teacher, as the sector struggles to attract staff and more than 1,000 teaching positions sit vacant across the state.

title.children: Country school gets creative to attract new teacher after a year-long search

image.altText: An illustration showing paint brushes and a life model

props.synopsis: Life modelling attracts people from all walks of life to showcase their bodies, but some in the industry say a reckoning is due for artists who overstep boundaries.

title.children: A model-led push for change has split Melbourne's life-drawing scene

image.altText: Analysis: What does the future hold? Inset image of John Lyons with a picture of a Syrian streetscape

props.synopsis: ABC global affairs editor John Lyons analyses the aftermath of the revolt that toppled Bashar al-Assad's government.

title.children: What the future holds for Syria following the fall of Assad

image.altText: A man in high-vis and ear protection smiles at the camera in a workshop

props.synopsis: When Anthony Best tells people what he does for a living, their first response is, "That's weird". If they knew where he'd been, they'd probably think differently.

title.children: Former prisoner finds fresh start making coffins as advocates fight employer bias

image.altText: Sandstone buildings on the University of Melbourne campus.

props.synopsis: The University of Melbourne will repay a total of $72 million to more than 25,000 underpaid staff after a decade of "unlawful" conduct, as part of an agreement with the Fair Work Ombudsman.

title.children: Melbourne Uni to repay $72 million after 'unlawful' conduct

image.altText: Two cars crashed into each other while emergency services stand beside them.

props.synopsis: An 82-year-old woman is in hospital fighting for life after a four-car crash in Oakleigh this morning.

title.children: Driver, 82, fights for life after four-car crash in Melbourne

image.altText: Close up, side shot of Mark Butler.

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mark Butler has called out "product phoenixing" — when health insurers close existing "gold" policies to new customers, but then introduce new, almost identical policies at a higher cost.

title.children: Minister vows crackdown on insurance charge loophole

image.altText: An aerial image of a saltwater crocodile in the water next to a reef.

props.synopsis: Swimmers are being urged to be cautious in Exmouth's waterways after three crocodile sightings in the area, which is well outside the reptiles' normal habitat.

title.children: WA tourist town records three saltwater crocodile sightings

image.altText: Phonics student writes word

props.synopsis: Primary school children are being taught the building blocks of language via a method that has had proven success overseas.

title.children: Victorian students to sit new test as part of move to 'phonics'

image.altText: A map of Australia.

props.synopsis: As climate change progresses, the CSIRO has created the first detailed national maps to help Australians understand the future risk to their properties.

title.children: These maps reveal Australia's potential bushfire future for every postcode

image.altText: A Syrian opposition fighter sits inside an office at the Presidential Palace

props.synopsis: With ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his family in Russia, his presidential palace is vacant and people are taking selfies and making off with the furniture.

title.children: Inside fallen Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad's now-looted presidential palace

image.altText: Bali Nine pair, Si Yi Chen and Matthew Norman, sit staring at the camera

props.synopsis: Australians Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Si-Yi Chen, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj are serving life sentences in Indonesia for their roles in a drug smuggling plot in 2005.

title.children: Indonesian president wants Bali Nine men back in Australia by Christmas
